Text: aboult friggin time, this is my all time favorite band:-) Great post, though actually "the smalls" had been out on tape since around 1990, with a cd release in 1993 with a few extra tracks.

i only saw on e smalls show i didn't like as much as the rest. they played the golden garter in edmonton for their 10 year anniversary, with strapping young lad and slow fresh oil opening. SYL complately slayed that show. every other show, from back at the bronx to red's, they were one of the best live acts...ever!!!

A few songs are done and play fine.

One of my all time favourite bands!!! Saw them several times back in the day, can't remember them all, one was on New Year's I think at Public Domain?  The other was in Leduc I think.  Also now that I think about it I believe I saw them as well in a place called The Rock Slide.  Can't remember the details but I remember the music and the pits.  Fun.
Pretty sure all these albums are available still from Stony Plain Records at $20 a piece.  I think that also includes shipping.  Just to let you know.

the smalls, they should have been bigger

Corb Lund is fine doing his country thing, puts on a good show I've seen twice but it is nothing compared to the smalls.
Wow, I can't believe this is still going.
